entries.text: Thank you for calling VeloFit customer support. Your call may be monitored for quality assurance. Please state the reason for your call.
Hi, I'd like to return a pair of cycling shoes I recently purchased.
Okay, I can certainly help you with that. Could you please provide your order number or the email address associated with your VeloFit account?
Thank you. I see the order here. The shoes were purchased on [date]. Before we proceed, could you confirm if you've tried them on, and if so, were they ever mounted on your bike?
Yes, I did try them on. And yes, they were mounted. I installed cleats on them and went for a couple of rides, but they just didn't fit right.

I understand. Unfortunately, because the shoes have been mounted and ridden, we are unable to accept them as a return. Once cleats are installed, it leaves cleat marks. That significantly reduces the value for resale. It becomes difficult to find another customer for an item that's been used in that way.
Oh, I also want to return this tire I bought.
And was this tire installed on your bike?
Yes, I put it on and rode it for a few miles.
I understand. With our return policy, because you rode on the tire, we cannot accept a return, as the dirty tires cannot be resold. I am very sorry, but used tires are non-returnable.
Oh, I see. That makes sense. So basically, anything that shows signs of use, like the cleat marks on the shoes or the dirty tires, can't be returned, even if it's just a little bit?

Exactly. Because they've been mounted and used, we consider them to be in a non-resellable condition. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. We do recommend checking our sizing guides and reading reviews before making a purchase to help avoid situations like this.
Okay, I understand. Thanks for explaining it to me. I appreciate your help.
You're very welcome. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Have a great day, and thank you for choosing VeloFit!
